Key Match Events: South Africa beat England by seven runs to close on semi-finals
England finish on 156-6 in pursuit of 164 in Saint Lucia
England were 61-4 and needed 101 from final nine overs before Harry Brook and Liam Livingstone shared 78
South Africa raced to 69-0 off seven overs but England rallied well to limit them to 163-6
Quinton de Kock top-scores with 65 and David Miller adds 43
Jofra Archer takes 3-40 and Jos Buttler claims superb catch and run out
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler: "I'd say it was lost in the powerplay. Quinton de Kock came out and played with really good intent and we couldn't really match that. I think we were about 20 behind them at the end of our first six."

South Africa captain Aiden Markam: "Getting to those last three overs and it looks like the odds are against you, to hang in there and get the win shows a lot of skill, but it comes from a lot deeper than that. Fighting spirit really helped us today."
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the match of group two in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup
The match had implications for England's qualification hopes
The game was played in Saint Lucia
Others: The winning moment was a catch by Aiden Markram to dismiss Harry Brook
The game went into the final over with England needing 9 runs to win
